title: What is your favorite line of a rap song? - Quora

response.answer_text: “I got white folk money that I won’t blow. If you ask me why, ‘cuz the white folk don’t.” AAAHHH lol I was so fucking stoked when I heard this line. I’ve heard hip-hop songs since about 2002 and I don’t think I’ve EVERRR heard anyone in that genre praise the idea of saving money instead of buying a ton of shit. “If you think these lyrics ain't deep, you too stupid to listen.” I know it doesn’t seem like the craziest lyric, but it’s more of the song as a whole that’s awesome. This is just said something at the end because I didn’t know which line I wanted to put on here. Gotta love my man Logic. (So I wrote this answer this morning/afternoon… It’s late night and I just happened to run across a comment of mine on one of his songs 5 years ago… Have to share because it’s so fucking cool lol. Never sold out. Ugh. <3)  “How much money you got? (A lot) How much money you got? (A lot) How much money you got? (A lot) How many problems you got? (A lot) How many people done doubted you? (A lot) Left you out to rot? (A lot) How many lawyers you got? (A lot) How many times you got shot? (A lot)” When I first heard this song I was like oh lord, another song fronting about how much money someone has… Rolls eyes. As soon as he started twisting it and talking about whether or not it was worth it to get to the top, it commanded my respect. “But bitch still bad to her if you say it the wrong wayBut she think she a bitch, what a double entendre.” Was sooo hard to find one line (or two) instead of entire verse, but finally found one to pull. Adding this song because it’s SOOO good and hopefully at least 3 people watch it lol.  “Fifty dollars for a T-shirt - that's just some ignorant bitch.” ‘Nuff said! XD “Maybe these are the momentsMaybe I've been missin' what it's aboutBeen scared of the future, thinkin' about the pastWhile missin' out on now.” That was really fun. Thanks for the question!

"When the devil asks you to dance, you better say never, cause a dance with the devil might last you forever.﻿“ - Dance with the Devil by Immortal Technique “Yo, fuck Hollywood, fuck all these reality showsMaking us feel lame unless we blowing stacks on new clothesMaking us feel like we ain't cool unless we have a few hoesMaking us feel like we ugly, unless we have a new noseI see naturally beautiful women get Botox, fake titsFake lips, they so brainwashed and it doesn't make senseFocus on your life and the path you're pursuing'Cause y'all too busy worried about what Kim Kardashian's doingCheck it, most of this shit that you sheep are watching on televisionIs fake as fuck and it's not real, I rebel against itIt's the Devil's business, they just reel y'all inIf they say it, we do it, yo, I'm tryna tell y'all manThe system created the stereotype for the Black imageThat's why my people are scared to be different, why don't you get it?I'm done practicing these ridiculous ritualsIt's time I become a real individual and just do me.” - Fly by Hopsin “Girls, stop acting like you want a guy with traits like RomeoBitch that's a fucking lieYou always talk about how every man's fakeAnd you can't take it and you want something realShut up tramp, save itTwice a week, you put on your makeup and damn braceletsAnd head to the club half-naked with your ass shakingPulling a lowlife n**** who claim he cash makingTill you let him hit and find out he work at the gas stationOne of them n***** got you pregnant and you can't raise itBut you caused it, your actions made a fat statementYou want Romeo, then act patientAnd stop fronting like he in the club posted in the back waitin'It's the club, where guys put on a new personaAfter they get loaded with a few CoronasThey always shouting and wild out with habits that very few condone ofThen they look for beautiful brainless bitches like you to bone 'emThen when they leave you, you cry and cryTalking 'bout, "oh my god I can't find a guyI've spent so many years and I've tried and triedWhy am I even on Earth, I should die!"You want Romeo, you're not worthyYou're cock-thirsty, you're nasty and probably got herpesSometimes the secret to finding is to stop searchingTry a new formula, 'cause your last one's not working.” - Ill Mind of Hopsin 5 by Hopsin “And to think I used to think you was the shit, bitchTo think it was you at one time I worshiped, shitThink you can hurt people and just keep getting away with it?” - Bad Guy by Eminem “Oh, hello son, I really wish I knew youI'm your father you'll probably never be introduced toYou'll only see me on TV or maybe YouTubeBy now I know your momma is probably dating some new dudeSo how you liking Earth? Are you loving your existence?I wasn't at your birth, 'cause your mother made me miss itI tried to get a visa, I applied and they denied it'Cause your momma told the police that I beat her, she was lyin'And now I'm banned for something bad that I ain't even doThere's a lot of land and water separating me and youYou're far away in Australia and I am in AmericaSo I cannot be there to do all of the things a parent doesThis is my attempt at me raisin' you from a distanceYou have Hopsin in your blood, you are special and you are giftedThe punishment your mother has given me doesn't seem fairJust know I love you, son, and I'm wishin' that I could be there.” - Ill Mind of Hopsin 9 by Hopsin And last but not least, the entire song of Ill Mind of Hopsin 7. It’s a must listen, but I’m not going to post the entire lyrics of the song here haha.
